intro: Viola sempervirens subsp. typica, commonly known as the common violet, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. The leaves and flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
